00030 
00031     BinaryReader::BinaryReader() {}
00032     BinaryReader::~BinaryReader(){}
00033     
00034             
00035     BinaryReader::Context & BinaryReader::context() throw(ReadingException) {
00036         if(!stack.size())
00037             throwIt("Empty stack");
00038         return stack.back();
00039     }
00040                 
00041     void BinaryReader::createContext(Context::State state, int length) throw(ReadingException) {
00042         stack.push_back(Context(state, 0, length));
00043     }
00044     
00045     void BinaryReader::enterContext(Context::State state) throw(ReadingException) {
00046         // check before
00047         int length = stream_read_int32();
00048         BINARY_READER_DEBUG("entering context of length " << length);
00049         size_t offset = context().baseoffset + context().index;
00050         advance(length);
00051         stack.push_back(Context(state, offset , length));
00052     }
00053     
00054     void BinaryReader::advance(int n) throw(ReadingException) {
00055         context().index = (size_t) (context().index + n);
00056         // negative means no limit
00057         if(context().length>=0)
00058         if(context().index>context().length) {
00059             throwIt("Gone past available data"); 
00060         }
00061     }
00062     
00063     void BinaryReader::expectState(Context::State state) throw(ReadingException) {
00064         if(context().state != state) {
00065             throwIt(string("I expected to be in state ") /*+ toString(state) XXX */ );  
00066         }
00067     }
00068 
00069     void BinaryReader::exitContext() throw(ReadingException) {
00070 /*      if(context().index<context().length) {
00071             throwIt("There are bytes left.");
00072         }*/ //FIXME prenditela con giorgio
00073         
00074         BINARY_READER_DEBUG("exiting context of length " << context().length);
00075         stack.pop_back();
00076     }
00077     
00078     void  BinaryReader::assertValidRead(cstr function) throw(ReadingException) {
00079         expectState(Context::ReadingObject);
00080         if(!context().ro_done_startReading) {
00081             throwIt(function + " called before startReading() ");
00082         }
00083     }
00084         
00085     Readable* BinaryReader::readObject(cstr name) throw(ReadingException) {
00086         bool present = checkName(name);
00087         
00088         int8_t type = stream_read_int8();
00089         if(type!=PACKET_HEADER_OBJECTWITHCLASS) 
00090             throwIt("I need a class name to instantiate");
00091             
00092             enterContext(Context::ReadingObject);
00093                 context().ro_version = stream_read_int8();
00094                 std::string className = context().ro_className = stream_read_string();
00095             
00096                 // instantiate
00097                 Readable * r = RDK2::Meta::forName(context().ro_className); 
00098                 if(!r)
00099                     throwIt(
00100                         string("Could not instantiate object of class")
00101                         +context().ro_className);   
00102                 
00103                 r->read(this);
00104                 
00105                 if(!context().ro_done_startReading)
00106                     throwIt(string("Object of class ") + className 
00107                         + " did not call startReading()."); 
00108                 
00109                 if(!context().ro_done_doneReading)
00110                     throwIt(string("Object of class ") + className 
00111                         + " did not call doneReading().");  
00112                 
00113             exitContext();
00114         if(present) exitContext();
00115         return r;
00116     }
00117         
00118     void BinaryReader::readObject(Readable*r, cstr name) throw(ReadingException) {
00119         BINARY_READER_DEBUG("Reading object, name = "<<name);
00120         bool present = checkName(name);
00121         BINARY_READER_DEBUG("Name present: "<<present);
00122         
00123         int8_t type = stream_read_int8();
00124         BINARY_READER_DEBUG("Packet is: "<<packetName(type));
00125             
00126             switch(type) {
00127                 case(PACKET_HEADER_OBJECTWITHCLASS): {
00128                     enterContext(Context::ReadingObject);
00129                         context().ro_version = stream_read_int8();
00130                         context().ro_className = stream_read_string();
00131                         BINARY_READER_DEBUG("Class name is: "<<context().ro_className);
00132                     break;
00133                 }
00134                 case(PACKET_HEADER_OBJECTNOCLASS):{
00135                     enterContext(Context::ReadingObject);
00136                         context().ro_className = "";
00137                         context().ro_version = 1;
00138                     break;
00139                 }
00140                 default:
00141                     throwIt("It is neither a name or object packet");
00142             }
00143             
00144                     r->read(this);
00145             
00146             string className = context().ro_className;
00147 
00148             if(!context().ro_done_startReading)
00149                 throwIt(string("Object of class ") + className + " did not call startReading().");  
00150             
00151             if(!context().ro_done_doneReading)
00152                 throwIt(string("Object of class ") + className + " did not call doneReading().");   
00153                         
00154         exitContext();
00155         if(present) exitContext();
00156     }
00157     
00158     unsigned char BinaryReader::startReading(cstr className) throw (ReadingException) {
00159         expectState(Context::ReadingObject);
00160         
00161         if(context().ro_done_startReading) {
00162             throwIt(string("startReading() already called (class=")+className+")");     
00163         }
00164         
00165         context().ro_done_startReading = true;
00166         
00167         if( (context().ro_className != "") && (context().ro_className != className)) {
00168             throwIt(string("I expected class ")+className+", instead I read "+context().ro_className);
00169         }
00170         
00171         if( context().ro_className == "") {
00172             context().ro_className = string(" (declared by Readable: ")+className+") "; 
00173         }
00174         BINARY_READER_DEBUG( "started reading class " << className);
00175         return context().ro_version;
00176     }
00177     
00178     void BinaryReader::doneReading() throw (ReadingException) {
00179         expectState(Context::ReadingObject);
00180         if(!context().ro_done_startReading) {
00181             throwIt("doneReading() called before startReading().");     
00182         }
00183         if(context().ro_done_doneReading) {
00184             throwIt("doneReading() already called.");   
00185         }
00186         context().ro_done_doneReading = true;
00187     }
00188     
00189         
00190     Readable * BinaryReader::deserialize(cstr buffer) {
00191         BINARY_READER_DEBUG(endl<<endl<<endl<<"Started reading from buffer" << endl);
00192         istringstream is(buffer);
00193         this->is = &is;
00194         stack.clear();
00195         createContext(Context::ReadingBuffer, buffer.length());
00196             Readable *r = readObject();
00197         exitContext();
00198         return r;
00199     }
00200     
00201     void BinaryReader::deserialize(cstr buffer, Readable *r) {
00202         BINARY_READER_DEBUG(endl<<endl<<endl<<"Started reading from buffer" << endl);
00203         istringstream is(buffer);
00204         this->is = &is;
00205         stack.clear();
00206         createContext(Context::ReadingBuffer, buffer.length());
00207             readObject(r);
00208         exitContext();
00209     }
